intro: Cyphostemma ruacanense, commonly known as the Ruacana moonvine, is a climbing plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, bead-like fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
